question: The "Popular Movement of the Revolution" was the sole-ruling political party of which nation from 1967 to 1997?
explanation: Popular Movement of the Revolution was the sole-ruling political party of Democratic Republic of Congo, formerly Zaire, from 1967 to 1997. It was the only political party permitted to function in Zaire's one-party state. It was founded by Mobutu Sese Seko. It was based on Zairian-African nationalism and conservatism; Anti-Communism and Anti-Capitalism. It got dissolved in 1997 when Mobutu Sese Seko, the then President of Zaire got ousted from power.
